intro: Cyperus oleraceus, commonly known as spikerush, is a perennial plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a member of the Cyperaceae family, which includes sedges and grass-like plants. The plant has slender, cylindrical stems that often grow in dense clusters, and its leaves are narrow and grass-like. Cyperus oleraceus produces small, spike-like clusters of flowers, typically in shades of green or brown. It is often found in wetland environments and is used in traditional medicine and as a food source in some cultures.
